entry.title: Craig Brown: What former players, colleagues and friends said about one of Scottish football's greatest icons
entry.summary: Former Scotland boss Craig Brown’s death aged 82 following a short illness has led to a flood of tributes from around Scottish football and beyond. The ex-Aberdeen and Motherwell manager was the last man to lead the national team to a World Cup and he holds the record for the number of international matches managed by a Scotland coach.

entry.summary: The transfer window has been open for less than two weeks but cinch Premiership sides have already been active, some more than others. In total 26 signings have been confirmed. Many of the names are familiar to Scottish football fans but there are some who will be new to the game north of the border. The Scotsman looks at some of those newcomers and what we can expect...

entry.title: I'll relish playing Michael Beale's new Rangers, says Brendan Rodgers
